1818.event: The World as Will and Representation (Schopenhauer)

1429.event: Joan of Arc defeats the English

1791.event: A Vindication of the Rights of Woman (Wollstonecraft)

Pepin the Short.name: Pepin the Short
events: Pushed out last Merovingian king to become first Carolingian monarch

Annointed Patrician of the Romans by Pope Stephen II

Carloman I.name: Carloman I
events: Competed with brother Charlemagne for control of Frankish lands

Charlemagne.name: Charlemagne
events: Crowned Emperor of the Romans by Pope Leo III
Conquered and Christianized the Saxons

Louis the Pious.name: Louis the Pious
events: Upon death, civil war broke out between his 3 sons

Charles the Bald.name: Charles the Bald
events: Lost Brittany to a Breton revolt
Invaded by brother, Louis the German, but recovered
Crowned Emperor of the Romans after death of Louis II

Louis the Stammerer.name: Louis the Stammerer
events: Declined the crown of Emperor of the Romans
Died during march against invading Vikings
Realms divided between sons Carloman II and Louis III

Louis III.name: Louis III
events: Received the northern part of his father's kingdom, Neustria

Carloman II.name: Carloman II
events: Received the southern part of his father's kingdom, Burgundy & Aquitaine

Charles the Fat.name: Charles the Fat
events: Reunited Francia through inheritance from father, brother, and cousin

Odo.name: Odo
events: As Count of Paris, defended it from the Vikings
Elected King of Francia after deposition of Charles the Fat

Charles III.name: Charles III
events: Succeeded Odo with support of cousin Arnulf of East Francia
Crowned king of Lotharia (middle Francia) in 911

Robert I.name: Robert I
events: Overthrew Charles III during revolt of the nobles

Rudolph.name: Rudolph
events: Son-in-law of Robert I, who was killed overthrowing Charles III

Louis V.name: Louis V

events: Brought Burgundy back under Frankish control

Henry I.name: Henry I

Louis VIII.name: Louis VIII

Philip III.name: Philip III

events: Allowed serfs to buy their freedom

John I.name: John I

Established Imperial succession in Golden Bull of 1356

Sigismund.name: Sigismund
events: Founded the Order of the Dragon to fight the Turks
Ended Papal Schism through the Council of Constance
Had Jan Hus executed after promising safe passage

Frederick III.name: Frederick III
events: Last Emperor to be crowned in Rome
Consolidated ancestral Habsburg land of Austria and Hungary

Maximilian I.name: Maximilian I
events: Proclaimed Emperor-elect at Trent
Lost Swiss territories to Swiss Confederacy
Established Habsburg dynasty in Spain via son's marriage to queen of Castile
relationships: Burgundy, Charles the Bold, Father-in-law, img/france/charles_the_bold.jpg

Charles V.name: Charles V
events: Financed conquistadores for Incan and Aztec expeditions
Organized Diet of Worms to halt the Protestant Reformation
Divided empire between Spanish and Austrian Habsburgs

Ferdinand I.name: Ferdinand I
events: Consolidated grasp over Hungary
Led Counter-Reformation, the Catholic response to Protestantism
relationships: Poland, Sigismund II Augustus, Son-in-law, img/poland/sigismund_ii_augustus.jpg

Maximilian II.name: Maximilian II
events: Established temporary peace with Protestants during the Confessionalization
Failed to evict Ottoman Turks from Hungary

Rudolf II.name: Rudolf II
events: Ineffectual ruler whose mistakes led to the Thirty Years' War
Influential patron of Northern Mannerist art
Intellectual devotee who helped seed the scientific revolution

Matthias.name: Matthias
events: Gave freedom of religion to the Dutch in Union of Utrecht
Imprisoned and stripped brother Rudolf II of all titles and land
Imprisoned Protestant leader Klesl during Bohemian Protestant revolt

Ferdinand II.name: Ferdinand II
events: A zealous Catholic, led the Thirty Years' War against Protestants
Put down Bohemian revolt led by Protestant Emperor Frederick V
Ended civil war component by signing Peace of Prague in 1635
relationships: Florence, Eleanor de' Medici, Mother-in-law, img/italy/eleanor_de_medici.jpg

Ferdinand III.name: Ferdinand III
events: Appointed head of the Imperial army during Thirty Years' War
Made peace with Protestant league in 1648 with Peace of Westphalia
relationships: Spain, Maria Anna, Wife & Cousin, img/spain/maria_anna.jpg
Spain, Philip IV, Brother-in-law & Son-in-law, img/spain/philip_iv.jpg

Leopold I.name: Leopold I
events: Received all of Kingdom of Hungary from Turks
Challenged the will of Spanish Charles II leaving Spain to France
wars: War of the Spanish Succession, France, 1701-1714
relationships: Spain, Margaret Theresa, Wife & Cousin, img/spain/margaret_theresa.jpg

Joseph I.name: Joseph I
events: Re-established Austrian hegemony over Italy
wars: War of the Spanish Succession, France, 1701-1714

Charles VI.name: Charles VI
events: Issued Pragmatic Sanction of 1713 establishing daughter Maria Theresa heiress
Ceded overseas trading company in exchange for foreign recognition
Upon death, recognition was reneged, leading to War of the Austrian Succession
wars: War of the Spanish Succession, France, 1701-1714

Charles VII.name: Charles VII
events: Elected Holy Roman Emperor over Maria Theresa through Salic Law
Overrun by Austrian Habsburg-Lorraine troops and fled to Frankfurt
Posthumously recognized by Habsburgs as Holy Roman Emperor

Francis I.name: Francis I
events: Won the War of Austrian Succession with Habsburg wife Maria Theresa
Pursued business while wife managed the affairs of the Empire

Joseph II.name: Joseph II
events: Valuing the Enlightenment, unsuccessfully attempted reforms
Passed 1783 Edict of Tolerance giving some freedom of religion
Opposed by Hungarian nobles and died ruined and abandoned

Leopold II.name: Leopold II
events: Publicly vowed to intervene in French Revolution in 1791
Contested for power over Hungary with King of Prussia
Contested for power over Poland with Catherine the Great

Francis II.name: Francis II
events: Defeated by Napoleon at the Battle of Austerlitz
Founded the Austrian Empire, becoming its first Emperor
Served as first president of German Confederation in 1815
wars: War of the Second Coalition, France, 1798-1802
War of the Third Coalition, France, 1803-1806
War of the Sixth Coalition, France, 1813-1814

Francis I.name: Francis I
events: Founded the Austrian Empire, becoming its first Emperor
Served as first president of German Confederation in 1815

Ferdinand I.name: Ferdinand I
events: Suffered from seizures, hydrocephaly, and speech impediment
Excluded from autonomous rule by father before death
Abdicated during Revolutions of 1848 in favor of nephew
relationships: Sardinia, Victor Emmanuel I, Father-in-law, img/italy/victor_emmanuel_sardinia.jpg

Franz Joseph I.name: Franz Joseph I
events: Lost claim to Tuscany and Northern Italy
Lost leadership of German Confederation to Prussia
Annexed Bosnia and Herzegovina, precipitating World War I
wars: Second Italian War of Independence, Italy, 1859
Third Italian War of Independence, Italy, 1866

Charles I.name: Charles I
events: Abdicated after armistice of World War I
Austrian Parliament passed Habsburg Law, banishing Habsburgs
Hungary proclaimed itself First Hungarian Republic
